books.title: After the Divorce
books.author: Grazia Deledda
books.summary: After her husband is wrongly convicted of murder, a young Sardinian woman driven into poverty is forced to divorce him and marry a wealthy but abusive man in order to survive.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: You Can’t Win
books.author: Jack Black
books.summary: Jack Black’s autobiographical account of life “on the road” as a professional thief and hobo during the late 19th century and early 20th century.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Through the Looking-Glass
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: In a follow-up to her adventures in Wonderland, Alice finds herself in a mirror image of the whimsical land where she becomes a queen in her own right.

books.title: Right Ho, Jeeves
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Bertie Wooster and his valet Jeeves try their hand at matchmaking in upper-class England.

books.title: The Winter’s Tale
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A king’s unfounded jealousy destroys his family and kingdom.

books.title: Kai Lung’s Golden Hours
books.author: Ernest Bramah
books.summary: An ancient Chinese storyteller charged with treason uses his beguiling tales to avoid conviction.

books.title: The Nigger of the Narcissus
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An Afro-Caribbean sailor enlists on a trading ship bound for London, but his health soon deteriorates.

books.title: The House on the Borderland
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: An account of the terrifying metaphysical haunting of a recluse’s secluded home.

books.title: The Life of Buffalo Bill
books.author: William F. Cody
books.summary: The 1879 autobiography of William F. Cody, more commonly known as Buffalo Bill, detailing his early life in the American West.

books.title: The Bungalow Mystery
books.author: Carolyn Keene
books.summary: A young amateur detective investigates a new friend’s abusive guardian.

books.title: How the Other Half Lives
books.author: Jacob Riis
books.summary: A social reformer documents the living conditions of the poor in the tenements of New York City.

books.title: Culture and Anarchy
books.author: Matthew Arnold
books.summary: Matthew Arnold describes what he considers to be the flaws in Victorian British society.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: James Weldon Johnson
books.summary: A collection of poems by James Weldon Johnson.

books.title: Gulliver’s Travels
books.author: Jonathan Swift
books.summary: An Englishman travels to fictional islands where he meets tiny people, giants, magicians and talking horses.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A collection of Fritz Leiber short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Hjalmar Söderberg
books.summary: A collection of Hjalmar Söderberg’s short stories, ordered by date of their translation.

books.title: Gitanjali
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Prose poems of offering translated by the author from the original Bengali.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.
